title: I want to write a book about my childhood but I don't want people to know my real name. Can I publish it under an alias? - Quora

response.answer_text: You can, yes—using a pen names is not uncommon. That said, if you are both talented and fortunate enough to have your book picked up by a publishing house, they are going to want you to do publicity to support your book. At the very least, that is going to include book signings near your home, and, if all goes well, people are going to see you. You won’t be able to duck under the table every time you see someone you know without attracting attention.

Such books are published every day. Many authors publish under pen names. Stephen King also publishes under the name Richard Bachman. You can also publish as anonymous. A recent example is A Woman in Berlin: A Woman in Berlin.
